id.title: Biomaterial Record ID
id.description: Any kind of globally unique identifier for any kind of Thing. Must be a URI or CURIE (e.g., 'fega:EGAN000000001', 'https://github.com/EGA-archive/fega-metadata-schema'...).

@type.title: Resource type
@type.description: The type of the resource. Used to state that a resource is an instance of a class. Can be a unique string or an array of strings if multiple types are applicable to the resource. For example, a person can be both a 'prov:Person' and a 'prov:Agent'. See https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#specifying-the-type for more details.

meta:sssomMappings.$comment: JSON-LD '@type' expands to RDF triples using predicate rdf:type.
From https://www.w3.org/TR/turtle/ 2.4: The token 'a' in the predicate position of a Turtle triple represents the IRI http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type

label.title: Label
label.description: A human-readable name, short title, or display label for the entity (e.g. subject id, cohort title, dataset title, etc.).

examples: This cohort encompasses 10,000 individuals who share the variant X at chromosome 10. Subjects were mainly recruited at ...
This dataset describes the context and methodology behind an omics experiment for differential expression analysis ...
Data file containing alignment for ... analysis.
The data policy of institution XYZ.

curieGeneralPattern.title: Compact URI (CURIE) pattern
curieGeneralPattern.description: A [W3C Compact URI](https://www.w3.org/TR/curie/) formatted string. A CURIE string has the structure ``prefix``:``reference``, as defined by the W3C syntax. Even though we do not restrict prefixes, we recommend that the term used as ``prefix`` is uniformly resolved. In other words, it is better to use prefixes (e.g. 'ensembl') from identifiers.org.

ontologyTerm.title: Ontology term
ontologyTerm.description: This property represents an ontology term (a.k.a. class). It consists on two properties: the term identifier (id) and its label (label). This property and its structure is inherited across many other elements in the schemas. It is there, when inherited, where the real ontology constraint is put in place (e.g. using 'graphRestriction' keywords). Similar to phenopacket's [OntologyClass](https://phenopacket-schema.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ontologyclass.html)

id.title: ID of the term
id.description: The identifier of an ontology term must be in CURIE format (check property 'curieGeneralPattern'). Whether a specific term is valid or not according to an ontology hierarchy is checked at each specific id using ontology validation keywords (e.g. 'graphRestriction').

allOf.title: General CURIE pattern

label.title: Label of the term
label.description: The label of a term is the human-readable string associated with the identifier. It is not required that it matches the label of the id within the referenced ontology, although it should. This is due to the fact that the source of truth will always be the id, and not the label, which adds more context.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

id.title: Ontology constraints for this specific id

homoSapiensTerm.$comment: #! Not in use currently, to be amended if not needed
homoSapiensTerm.title: Homo Sapiens Term

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

relationshipItem.title: Relationship item
relationshipItem.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic format of a relationship item. Each of the items is expected to be one of the ends of the possible relationships in a linked metadata entity.
relationshipItem.$comment: #! We may want to add a pattern check here, so that for example if 'biomaterial' is the '@type', the ID of the entity is 'EGAN...'. The issue for which I haven't added it yet is that FEGA identifiers are still being discussed and that it would be constraining external references to other archives (e.g., the activity that generated a file could be in a different archive, and not have an EGA stable ID).

relationshipArray.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic format of a relationship array. These arrays contain relationship items and semantically represent a type of relationship or linkage across entities in the linked data space.

HL7NullFlavor.title: HL7 Null Flavor
HL7NullFlavor.description: Captures why a value is missing, unknown, or inapplicable, per a subset of the HL7 Null Flavor codes. See more details at 'https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-v3-NullFlavor.html'.

meta:enum.ASKU: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'ASKU'. Display Name: 'Asked But Unknown'. Definition: 'The value was sought but the source does not know it.' Example: 'A participant was asked about their precise birth time, but they had no knowledge of it.'
meta:enum.MSK: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'MSK'. Display Name: 'Masked'. Definition: 'Information is intentionally withheld, typically due to privacy or confidentiality.' Example: 'A patient's exact residential address is masked from public view for confidentiality.'
meta:enum.NA: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'NA'. Display Name: 'Not Applicable'. Definition: 'A value is conceptually not relevant or cannot exist in this context.' Example: 'Trying to capture the last menstrual cycle for a male patient is not applicable.'
meta:enum.NASK: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'NASK'. Display Name: 'Not Asked'. Definition: 'No attempt was made to collect or ascertain the value.' Example: 'A survey question about smoking history was omitted, so no data was collected.'
meta:enum.NAV: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'NAV'. Display Name: 'Not Available'. Definition: 'Information is temporarily absent but may become available later.' Example: 'A patient's lab result is pending and will be provided once finalized.'
meta:enum.NI: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'NI'. Display Name: 'No Information'. Definition: 'Absolutely no details are available at any level.' Example: 'A record for a visit exists, but no demographic or clinical data were recorded at all.'
meta:enum.OTH: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'OTH'. Display Name: 'Other'. Definition: 'A valid value exists, but it is not represented in the known code set or categories.' Example: 'The schema's enum for a field does not include the value at hand.'
meta:enum.UNK: HL7 NullFlavor Code 'UNK'. Display Name: 'Unknown'. Definition: 'A suitable value is applicable but is not currently known.' Example: 'A patient's middle name is valid information to collect, but it is not documented.'

diagnosis.title: Diagnosis
diagnosis.description: A diagnosis (e.g., Marfan syndrome â€” MONDO:0007043): a clinical or research conclusion about the underlying cause of the biomaterial abnormalities. It is an inference: clinicians or researchers review multiple observations and decide that they collectively point to a specific disorder. Unlike a 'phenotypicFeature', a diagnosis is not itself observed; it is a hypothesis that explains why those observations occur. This entity can be used for both clinical diagnosis (if within a biomaterial of type 'organism') and pathological diagnosis (if within a biomaterial of type other than 'organism').

meta:sssomMappings.$comment: GDI Harmonised Minimal Data Model v1.0 has not been submitted publicly yet. Hence the lack of a proper URI for the object.

diagnosisType.title: Diagnosis type
diagnosisType.description: Classifies the diagnosis by the primary evidence used to establish it.

meta:enum.clinical: Inference made from clinical presentation (signs, symptoms, imaging, standard laboratory tests) before or without tissue confirmation.
meta:enum.pathological: Conclusion reached by examining tissue or cells (histology, cytology, immunohistochemistry, gross pathology).
meta:enum.molecular: Diagnosis supported predominantly by molecular evidence such as DNA/RNA sequencing, gene-expression profiling, methylation arrays or proteomics.

term.title: Disease term
term.description: Denotes the diagnosis by means of an ontology class. Use term IDs and Labels from multiple ontologies (e.g., EFO, MONDO, HP, SNOMED, ORDO...). Other common classifications (e.g., ICD10 or OMIM) are included through one of these ontologies (e.g., ORDO).

meta:sssomMappings.$comment: GDI Harmonised Minimal Data Model v1.0 has not been submitted publicly yet. Hence the lack of a proper URI for the object. GDI's definition of 'diagnosis' falls under 'disease' mainly due to the allowed values given for a diagnosis: SNOMED 'Disease'.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

excluded.title: Excluded
excluded.description: Property that specifies whether the disease was observed or not. Similar to phenopacket's 'excluded' property, by default it is 'false', which means that the disease was observed (i.e. it's not excluded). Therefore it is only required (as 'true') in cases to indicate that the disease was looked for, but found to be absent. The terms 'not excluded' (i.e. false) and 'excluded' (i.e. true) correlate with the common notation of 'case' versus 'control', respectively. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the ontology term used as disease term. For example, if the disease term is 'measles', and 'excluded' is 'true', then it's implied that a diagnosis for 'measles' was attempted, but the individual did not have such disease, thus being considered part of the 'control' group for that specific disease.

meta:sssomMappings.$comment: The material_sample from phenopackets allows the user to define whether a sample is reference (a.k.a. control) or abnormal (a.k.a. case). This information can be encoded easily in the diagnosis, introducing the ability to specify **for which** diagnosis (i.e. disease) a sample may be control or case.

onset.$comment: Reference to be modified (#!) when Beacon v2 gets '$id's for their JSON Schemas (see details at https://github.com/ga4gh-beacon/beacon-v2/issues/206). Until then, a temporary fork (M-casado/beacon-v2/biovalidator-test) would work as a placeholder.

diseaseStage.$comment: Reference to be modified (#!) when Beacon v2 gets '$id's for their JSON Schemas (see details at https://github.com/ga4gh-beacon/beacon-v2/issues/206). Until then, a temporary fork (M-casado/beacon-v2/biovalidator-test) would work as a placeholder.

primarySite.title: Primary site
primarySite.description: Primary (affected) anatomical site of the disease.

laterality.title: Laterality
laterality.description: The term used to indicate laterality of diagnosis, if applicable. Recommended terms are children of 'geometric modifier' (EFO:0001648).

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

laterality.$comment: #! Would this need to be an array to define better in 3D a disease? E.g., 'left' + 'caudal'

diagnosisTime.title: Diagnosis time
diagnosisTime.description: When the diagnosis was performed. The time element offers flexibility to define the moment of diagnosis in different ways (e.g., age of organism, timestamp, etc.).

allOf.title: Compatibility with Beacon v2 JSON Schema
allOf.$comment: Reference to be modified (#!) when Beacon v2 gets '$id's for their JSON Schemas (see details at https://github.com/ga4gh-beacon/beacon-v2/issues/206). Until then, a temporary fork (M-casado/beacon-v2/biovalidator-test) would work as a placeholder.

tumorAttributes.title: Tumor attributes
tumorAttributes.description: Tumor-specific modifiers of a neoplasm diagnosis.

tnmFindings.title: TNM Findings
tnmFindings.description: Primary tumor (T), regional lymph-node (N) and distant-metastasis (M) categories. AJCC / UICC stage that integrates T, N and M categories (e.g. *Stage IIA*). Tumor stage as classified by the TNM system. T describes the size (for specific size use 'tumorSize') of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue; N describes regional lymph nodes that are involved; M describes distant metastasis (spread of cancer from one body part to another). Recommended terms include children of EFO 'tumor stage' (EFO:0004925), NCIt 'Cancer TNM Finding' (NCIT:C48232) and SNOMED 'Tumor finding (finding)' (SNOMED:395557000).

items.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

tumorGrade.title: Tumor grade
tumorGrade.description: Histological or nuclear grade of the tumor. Use NCIt (children term of NCIT:C28076: 'Disease Grade Qualifier') or SNOMED morphology grade classes. See the [tumor grade fact sheet](https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/diagnosis-staging/diagnosis/tumor-grade).

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

tumorProgression.title: Tumor progression
tumorProgression.description: This field can be used to indicate if a specimen is from the primary tumor, a metastasis or a recurrence. There are multiple ways of representing this using ontology terms, and the terms chosen should have a specific meaning that is application specific. For example a term from the following NCIT terms from the Neoplasm by Special Category can be chosen: 'Primary Neoplasm' (NCIT:C8509), 'Metastatic Neoplasm' (NCIT:C3261), 'Recurrent Neoplasm' (NCIT:C4798).

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

tumorSize.title: tumor size measurements
tumorSize.description: One or more measurements of the diagnosed tumor.

stagingSystemVersion.description: Edition and/or year of the staging system used (e.g. 'AJCC 8th ed. (2018)').

phenotypicFeature.title: Phenotypic feature
phenotypicFeature.description: A phenotypic feature is an observable trait (e.g., Aortic root dilation â€” HP:0002616) that characterizes a biomaterial. It is a direct observation: something seen, measured, or reported about a biomaterial. Unlike a 'disease', a phenotypic feature makes no claim about underlying cause; it simply records what is (or is not) present.

meta:sssomMappings.$comment: GDI Harmonised Minimal Data Model v1.0 has not been submitted publicly yet. Hence the lack of a proper URI for the object.

allOf.$comment: Reference to be modified (#!) when Beacon v2 gets '$id's for their JSON Schemas (see details at https://github.com/ga4gh-beacon/beacon-v2/issues/206). Until then, a temporary fork (M-casado/beacon-v2/biovalidator-test) would work as a placeholder.

vitalStatus.title: Vital Status
vitalStatus.description: Represents whether the organism is living or dead (or unknown) at the time point when the metadata was collected and/or reported. In practice, this element is useful in cohort studies in which the association of some treatment or genetic variation is compared with mortality. For many other applications, it may not be necessary to use a vitalStatus element.

timeOfDeath.title: Time of death
timeOfDeath.description: Represents the time of death of the organism. Not to be used if the organism is not known to be dead.

allOf.title: Compatibility with Beacon v2 JSON Schema
allOf.$comment: Reference to be modified (#!) when Beacon v2 gets '$id's for their JSON Schemas (see details at https://github.com/ga4gh-beacon/beacon-v2/issues/206). Until then, a temporary fork (M-casado/beacon-v2/biovalidator-test) would work as a placeholder.

causeOfDeath.title: Cause of death
causeOfDeath.description: Represents the cause of death of the organism. Not to be used if the organism is not known to be dead.
causeOfDeath.$comment: I don't think restricting the ontology term here is doable, since this could be quite literally anything in the semantic space.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

examples.label: Hit by boat while water skiing (event)

survivalTimeInDays.title: Survival time in days
survivalTimeInDays.description: Number of days the organism was alive after their primary diagnosis.

meta:sssomMappings.$comment: GDI Harmonised Minimal Data Model v1.0 has not been submitted publicly yet. Hence the lack of a proper URI for the object.

type.title: Type of exposure
type.description: The primary ontology class which describes the exposure. Terms from the [Environment Exposure Ontology (ECTO)](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/ecto) are recommended, but not exclusive.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

negated.title: Negated exposure
negated.description: Flag to indicate whether the exposure occurred or not. Default is 'false', in other words the exposure has occurred. Therefore it is **only** required in cases to indicate that the exposure was deemed *not* to have happened. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the ontologyTerm used in the 'type' property. CAUTION It is imperative to check this field for correct interpretation of the exposure!

route.title: Route of exposure
route.description: Mechanism of the exposure. Ontology terms from the [NCIT](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/ncit) are recommended for this purpose.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

modifiers.title: Modifiers of the exposure

items.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

modifiers.$comment: Again, I'm unsure if to constraint the terms and/or labels to a set of ontologies (e.g., ECTO), or leave it open like now.

occurrence.title: occurrence
occurrence.description: When the exposure occurred. The timeElement offers flexibility (e.g., age of the organism, timestamp, period of time...).

allOf.title: Compatibility with Beacon v2 JSON Schema
allOf.$comment: Reference to be modified (#!) when Beacon v2 gets '$id's for their JSON Schemas (see details at https://github.com/ga4gh-beacon/beacon-v2/issues/206). Until then, a temporary fork (M-casado/beacon-v2/biovalidator-test) would work as a placeholder.

evidence.description: Evidences for how the exposure was determined.

items.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

examples.label: coordinate mapping to geographic property shapefiles used in manual assertion

unit.title: Unit of exposure
unit.description: Unit of the exposure. Recommended to use terms from the Units of measurement Ontology ((UO)[https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/uo]) or children terms of the NCIT 'Unit by Category' (NCIT:C42568).

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of id and label

value.title: Value of unit
value.$comment: I thought of adding a 'minimum' of 0, but I guess there may be a weird case of 'negated' exposure where someone may want to measure 'how much the exposure' was negated.

description.title: Exposure description
description.description: Free-text description of the exposure. Only to be used to encompass additional information that otherwise could not be added by using the other exposure fields. In other words, use the other curated fields to provide the key information about the exposure.
examples: Accidental arsenic ingestion from a herbal medicine product
Patient got burnt with the Electric Kettle when making tea

ancestryComponent.title: Ancestry component
ancestryComponent.description: Population category of a biomaterial. Defined using ancestry informative markers (AIMs) based on genetic/genomic data.
ancestryComponent.$comment: Similar to ethnicity, we could want to be restrictive and validate the ontology term IDs and labels, rather than a plain recommendation.

term.title: Ancestry term
term.description: Term encoding the ancestry of the biomaterial. Recommended values come from the 'ancestry category' ([HANCESTRO:0004](http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HANCESTRO_0004))

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

method.title: Method of inference
method.description: Technique or information source used to assign the ancestry. Recommended values come from the Evidence & Conclusion Ontology (ECO) (e.g., ECO:0006395 for 'self-reported ancestry evidence') or the Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI) (e.g., OBI:0200051 for 'principal components analysis dimensionality reduction').

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

examples.label: intermethylated site amplification evidence used in automatic assertion

proportion.title: Genomic proportion
proportion.description: Estimated fraction of the genome assigned to this ancestry category, expressed as a value between 0 and 1.

anatomicalEntity.title: Anatomical entity
anatomicalEntity.description: Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

id.title: Ontology constraints for this specific id

label.title: Ontology constraints for this specific label

value.title: Value
value.description: Numeric value of the measured quantity.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: Unit of the measured quantity. Recommended terms are children of: 'unit' (UO:0000000) from the the [Units of measurement ontology (UO)](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/uo); or 'Unit of Measure' (NCIT:C25709) from the NCIt.

method.title: Method
method.description: Method of measurement of the quantity. Defined either as a qualified reference or an ontology term.

examples.label: pathogen detection by Rapid Analyte Measurement Platform assay

referenceRange.title: Compatibility with Beacon v2 JSON Schema
referenceRange.$comment: Reference to be modified (#!) when Beacon v2 gets '$id's for their JSON Schemas (see details at https://github.com/ga4gh-beacon/beacon-v2/issues/206). Until then, a temporary fork (M-casado/beacon-v2/biovalidator-test) would work as a placeholder.

fileFormat.title: File format
fileFormat.description: Format of the file containing the data. A defined way or layout of representing and structuring data in a computer file, blob, string, message, or elsewhere.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

id.title: Ontology constraints for this specific id

label.title: Ontology constraints for this specific label

dateTime.title: Date and time
dateTime.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format.

qualifiedAssociation.title: Qualified association
qualifiedAssociation.description: Individual association between the root entity (subject) and another entity (object). An activity association is an assignment of responsibility to an agent for an activity, indicating that the agent had a role in the activity. It further allows for a plan to be specified, which is the plan intended by the agent to achieve some goals in the context of this activity.

agent.title: Agent
agent.description: An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity.

atLocation.title: Location
atLocation.description: Where the agent is located (e.g., research institution, country, etc.).

hadRole.description: Array of relationships pointing to roles (object) that were played by the agent (subject) in the context of a process (i.e., the prov:activity).

hadPlan.description: Array of relationships pointing to plans (object) that were intended by the agent (subject) to achieve some goals in the context of a process (i.e., the prov:activity).

location.title: Location
location.description: A specific place (e.g., country) or position (e.g., a research institute). Not to be confused with 'anatomicalEntity' which refers to a location within a biological entity.

allOf.title: Inherited ontologyTerm structure of term id and label

id.title: Ontology constraints for this specific term id

label.title: Ontology constraints for this specific term label

relationshipItemRestrictionBiomaterial.title: Relationship item restriction: Biomaterial
relationshipItemRestrictionBiomaterial.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic restriction for a relationship item to be of @type 'biomaterial'.

relationshipItemRestrictionStudy.title: Relationship item restriction: Study
relationshipItemRestrictionStudy.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic restriction for a relationship item to be of @type 'study'.

relationshipItemRestrictionProcess.title: Relationship item restriction: Process
relationshipItemRestrictionProcess.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic restriction for a relationship item to be of @type 'process'.

relationshipItemRestrictionProtocol.title: Relationship item restriction: Protocol
relationshipItemRestrictionProtocol.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic restriction for a relationship item to be of @type 'protocol'.

relationshipItemRestrictionCohort.title: Relationship item restriction: Cohort
relationshipItemRestrictionCohort.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic restriction for a relationship item to be of @type 'cohort'.

relationshipItemRestrictionDatafile.title: Relationship item restriction: Datafile
relationshipItemRestrictionDatafile.description: This entity is expected to be referenced where needed, as it contains the basic restriction for a relationship item to be of @type 'datafile'.

sameAs.description: Relationship referencing other entities (object) considered equivalent to the root entity (subject).

wasUsedBy.description: Relationship referencing other entities (object) by which the the root entity (subject) was used.

used.description: Relationship referencing other entities (object) that used the root entity (subject).

wasGeneratedBy.description: Array of relationships referencing the activity, workflow step or other entity (object) that generated (i.e. first brought into existence) the root entity (subject).

generated.description: Array of relationships referencing the entities (object) that were generated by the root entity (subject). This is the inverse of 'wasGeneratedBy'.

wasDerivedFrom.description: Array of relationships referencing source entities (object) from which the root entity (subject) is transformed, updated or otherwise derived.

isBasedOn.description: Array of relationships referencing source entities (object) on which the root entity (subject) is based, or from which it is a modification or adaptation.

wasAttributedTo.description: Array of relationships linking the object agent (person, organisation or software) that is responsible for or contributed to the existence, content or state of the root (subject) entity.

actedOnBehalfOf.description: Array of relationships indicating delegation: the root agent (subject) carried out an activity on behalf of another agent (object).

isPartOf.description: Array of relationships pointing to a broader resource (object) (study, dataset, publication, collection, project, etc.) of which the root entity (subject) forms a logical or physical part.

hasPart.description: Array of relationships pointing to related resources that are included either physically or logically in the subject resource.

hasParent.$comment: #! TBD: schema:parent, also reversible with the children

hadMember.description: A collection is an entity that provides a structure to some constituents, which are themselves entities. These constituents are said to be member of the collections. For example, a 'cohort' 'hadMember' 'biomaterial'.

wasAssociatedWith.description: Array of activity associations. An activity association is an assignment of responsibility to an agent for an activity, indicating that the agent had a role in the activity. It further allows for a plan to be specified, which is the plan intended by the agent to achieve some goals in the context of this activity.

allOf.title: Prohibition of hadRole as a property
allOf.description: Constraint to force hadRole within a qualifiedAssociation property, and not directly here.

wasInformedBy.description: Array of relationships pointing to processes (object) that informed the root process (subject). For example, a process 'activity2' was informed by another process 'activity1' if 'activity1' generated an entity (e.g., a data file) that was used in 'activity2'.

informs.description: Array of relationships pointing to processes (object) that were informed by the root process (subject). This is the inverse of 'wasInformedBy'.
